CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper November 27, 1954, pg. 11, reads: "Dolls for Africa - Members of the Missionary Society of Trinity AME Church, packed eighteen unbreakable colored dolls and wrapped 110 bars of chocolate candy in their meeting last week to send to Mrs. Frederick D. Jordan in South Africa for distribution at Christmas. Pictured, seated, left, Mrs. Juanita S. Hall, and right, Mrs. Sylvia Cheek. Standing, left to right: Mmes. Jessie Brewer, Mattie Hightower, Isabelle Hunter, Effie Williams and Melvalee Hampton. Back row: Mrs. Mamie Ellison, Mrs. Odessa Bussey, Mrs. Ethel Leftwich, Mrs. Edith Smith and Mrs. Alma A. Polk, connectional director of the Young People's Department of the Women's Missionary Society, who sponsored the project."
TitMainTitle: Six girls and young women and two boys gathered with dolls and candy bars for Missionary Society of Trinity AME Church drive for Christmas gifts to South Africa
